metadata.feature_description: View and manage system-generated URLs with sorting and filtering capabilities

steps.action: Navigate to Content > Pages > select Home page
steps.actual: Page details panel appeared with Details, Permissions, and Advanced tabs

steps.expected: URLs for this page section should display system-generated URLs
steps.actual: URLs section displayed showing '/' as system-generated URL with Active (200) status and 'Automatic' as Generated By

steps.action: Select 'Our Products' page and view S.E.O. tab
steps.expected: System-generated URL for Our Products page should be displayed
steps.actual: Displayed '/Our-Products' with Active (200) status and Automatic generator

steps.action: Select 'News' page and view S.E.O. tab
steps.expected: System-generated URLs for News page should be displayed

steps.action: View URLs list on News page S.E.O. tab and observe URL ordering
steps.expected: URLs should be displayed in sorted order
steps.actual: URLs are displayed sorted by URL path. Active (200) URL shown first, followed by Redirect (301) URLs. Code review confirms sorting is supported via API parameters (sortField: URL=1, Locale=2, Status=3) with sortOrder (ascending/descending)

steps.action: Observe column headers (URL, URL TYPE, GENERATED BY)
steps.expected: Column headers may be clickable for sorting
steps.actual: Column headers are visible. The current UI view does not expose interactive column sorting controls, but the backend API supports sorting by URL, Locale, and Status fields as confirmed in code review

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View URL details including site alias and query strings

steps.action: Click 'Add URL' button to view URL detail fields
steps.expected: Add URL form should show available fields including Site Alias
steps.actual: Add URL form displayed with Site Alias dropdown, URL Path text field, and URL Type dropdown

steps.expected: URL list should show URL, URL Type, and Generated By
steps.actual: URL list correctly displays URL path, URL Type (status code), and Generated By (Automatic for system-generated). Site Alias is shown in the Add URL form. Query String field is supported in the backend API (UrlDto.QueryString) but not exposed in this specific UI view

steps.action: Click Site Alias dropdown in Add URL form
steps.expected: Dropdown should show available site aliases including locale-specific ones
steps.actual: Site Alias dropdown displayed three options: 'localhost:8081', 'localhost:8081/en-us', 'localhost:8081/es-es' - demonstrating locale-specific alias support

steps.expected: Different locales should be available for URL filtering/creation
steps.actual: English (en-us) and Spanish (es-es) locale-specific site aliases are available, enabling locale-based URL management

steps.action: Click URL Type dropdown in Add URL form
steps.expected: Dropdown should show available URL status types
steps.actual: URL Type dropdown displayed two options: 'Active (200)' and 'Redirect (301)'

steps.action: Verify status codes match URL list display
steps.actual: News page URL list shows both Active (200) and Redirect (301) statuses, matching the dropdown options. System correctly generates redirect URLs for alternate paths

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify pagination for large URL lists

steps.action: View URL lists across multiple pages (Home, Our Products, News)
steps.expected: If there are many URLs, pagination controls should appear
steps.actual: Tested pages showed 1-3 URLs each. With this number of URLs, all are displayed without pagination. The News page showed the most URLs (3 system-generated) which all fit on screen. Backend API supports pagination parameters but with the current test data volume, pagination was not triggered

observations: System-generated URLs are displayed in the Page Settings > Advanced > S.E.O. tab under 'URLs for this page' section
URLs are marked with 'Automatic' in the 'Generated By' column to identify system-generated URLs vs custom URLs
The system generates multiple URLs for the same page including redirect (301) URLs for alternate paths
Code review confirms API supports sorting by URL (1), Locale (2), and Status (3) fields via sortField parameter, with ascending/descending via sortOrder parameter
Site Alias dropdown shows locale-specific aliases (en-us, es-es) enabling localized URL management
Query String field is supported in the backend UrlDto but not visible in the current Add URL form UI
Redirect URLs (301) can be deleted via trash icon while Active (200) primary URLs cannot be deleted
The feature is page-specific - each page has its own set of system-generated URLs accessed through its page settings
